meanings.definition: To make white or lighter in color by exposure to sunlight or by using chemicals.
meanings.sent1: She was bleaching her hair to make it lighter for the summer.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent was bleaching the white shirts effectively.
meanings.sent3: The sun seemed to be in a bleaching competition with the bleach.
meanings.sent4: His smile was so bright, it seemed like he was bleaching the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush danced across the canvas, bleaching it with strokes of white.

meanings.definition: The process of removing color or stains from something.
meanings.sent1: The bleaching of the old tablecloth removed all the stubborn stains.
meanings.sent2: She used a strong bleaching agent to clean the bathroom tiles.
meanings.sent3: The bleaching of the red wine spill turned into a magic show.
meanings.sent4: The bleaching of the graffiti from the wall revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The bleaching of the fabric made it look brand new again.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming white or lighter in color.
meanings.sent1: The bleaching of the leaves in autumn signaled the change of season.
meanings.sent2: The bleaching of the paint on the old house gave it a vintage look.
meanings.sent3: The bleaching of the clouds made them look like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The bleaching of the sand under the scorching sun was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The bleaching of the paper over time made it fragile and yellowed.
